creator: ScentroidApps
descriptionHtml:
PolluTracker (TR8+) is an Android application, which allows to connect and use Scentroid's PolluTracker devices and measure pollution level in specified area.

WARNING:
- If you have been previously using TR8/TR8+ application, please be advised that the new version of the app listed here (as of January 2020) is not compatible with the old database; therefore, "Import" functionality won't work with the old measurements.
What can be done to save the data? You can save the old measurements as a CSV file by using the feature that is available in the old version of the application (in Records section).

The list of features includes:
- Bluetooth remote connection to PolluTracker
- Auto re-calibration of a device
- Manual re-calibration
- Keeping detailed log of received data
- User friendly display of the previous measurements from DB
- Exporting/Importing of a DB
- Graphical representation of a current measurement
- Various indicators that allow user to keep track of what is happening with PolluTracker (geo-location, temperature, battery life, humidity, pressure)
- Audible signaling if one/many of the sensors go off set-up limit
- Ability to manually set-up AQ limit, sensitivity, and offset for each sensor
- 4 different scales (ppm, ppb, mg/m^3, OU) that can be applied to sensors individually
- Keeping track of different projects
- Showing the measurements on Google Map
descriptionShort: Pollution Tracker application for measuring pollution level in specified area

appDetails.recentChangesHtml: - Fixed an issue with displaying Google Maps

- Support of higher number of sensors
- Enhanced "Excel reporting" feature

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Included in this release:
- Resolved possible crashes caused by selection of % as sensor scale
- In Sensor Settings page, rearranged sensor names in the dropdown menus in alphabetical order for easier selection

Recent updates:
- Added THT into the sensor list as requested
- Changed default sensitivity to 1.0;
- Added correct conversion calculation for ppm to %
- Added % scale option for all other gases (while Oxygen still has % as default option).

Fixed SQLite crash issue for adding new columns.

Previously:
Add latitude and longitude to seconds table so that the coordinates data updates real-time as well.
